baseline_groups.claim_summary: Villages above the 1000-population threshold in the 1991 census (solo Gram Panchayats) have better educational outcomes, measured by a composite education index (Table 2)
baseline_groups.notes: Table 2 main result. RD at 1991 population cutoff of 1000 using rdrobust. Clustered at GP level. Baseline coefficient 0.095 (p<0.001). Robustness specs include bandwidth, polynomial, kernel, donut, sample, inference, controls, functional form variations.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Villages above the 1000-population threshold in the 1991 census have better village-level infrastructure, measured by a composite village amenities index (Table 2)
baseline_groups.notes: Table 2 main result. RD at 1991 population cutoff. Baseline coefficient 0.057 (p=0.013). Robustness specs parallel G1.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Villages above the 1000-population threshold in the 1991 census have better household-level infrastructure, measured by a composite household amenities index (Table 2)
baseline_groups.notes: Table 2 main result. RD at 1991 population cutoff. Baseline coefficient 0.097 (p<0.001). Robustness specs parallel G1.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Villages above the 1000-population threshold in the 2011 census have better welfare program delivery, measured by a Mission Antyodaya programs index (Table 3, Panel A)
baseline_groups.notes: Table 3 Panel A main result. RD at 2011 population cutoff of 1000 using rdrobust. Clustered at GP level. Baseline coefficient 0.100 (p=0.008). Robustness specs include bandwidth, polynomial, kernel, donut, sample, inference, controls, functional form variations.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Villages above the 1000-population threshold in the 2011 census have better NREGS workfare performance, measured by a composite NREGS performance z-score (Table 3, Panel B)
baseline_groups.notes: Table 3 Panel B main result. RD at 2011 population cutoff. Baseline coefficient 0.157 (p<0.001). Robustness specs parallel G4.

global_notes: This paper uses a regression discontinuity design at the village population threshold of 1000 in Uttar Pradesh, India. Villages above this threshold were assigned as standalone Gram Panchayats (solo GPs), while smaller villages were grouped into multi-village GPs. The paper reports results from two delimitation episodes: 1991 (Table 2, amenities/education outcomes) and 2011 (Table 3, welfare programs and NREGS). The 15 baselines include 5 main index outcomes (groups G1-G5) plus 10 additional outcomes (individual school variables, BPL cards, health insurance, pensions, electricity, person-days, labor expenditure) that are baseline-only without dedicated robustness specs. The 5 main index outcomes have 171 associated robustness/sensitivity specifications across bandwidth, polynomial order, kernel, donut hole, sample restriction, clustering, control progression, functional form, alternative outcomes/treatments, placebo tests, and heterogeneity analyses.
